fee_structure.demonstrate_knowledge_about_the_dynamics: Apply Sociological theories and perspectives to social reality
Analyze and engage with the social surroundings, problematise and raise questions  AND  Apply their knowledge  for  welfare initiatives
Demonstrate awareness of local, regional, national and global socio-cultural environmental needs and concerns
Ability to conduct Social Research AND Will have technical skills and mastery over software packages such as SPSS
Demonstrate soft skills such as presentation skills and interpersonal skills. AND Exhibit lateral and analytical thinking skills

why_choose: Why choose this course? focuses on the practical application of sociological concepts advanced research and data analysis skills build networks with like-minded individuals development of critical thinking ability apply sociological knowledge to other domains develop excellent qualitative and quantitative research skills
what_learn: What you will learn? Through this program, the students can gain an in-depth understanding and knowledge of classical and contemporary sociological theories. Students will excel in quantitative and qualitative research methods, including surveys, interviews, content analysis, and statistical analysis. Application of sociological research to address real-world problems in areas like education, healthcare, criminal justice, environmental sustainability, and more. Collaboration with professionals from other fields, such as social work, public health, and education, to address complex social problems. Strong emphasis on academic writing, including research papers and reports and development of critical thinking ability Completion of a dissertation that demonstrates the ability to conduct independent research and contribute to the field.
modules: Modules Qualitative Research Methods Introduction to Social statistics and corporate sociology Year 1 Gender studies, Indian society and social demography Introduction to social theories and research methods Human rights and sociology of law Introduction to media, gerontology and diaspora Year 2 Social Psychology and sociology of health Starting of dissertation and one month internship
career: Career prospects Interdisciplinary framework where students get to learn not only about sociology but also various other domains like HR, PR, CSR that help upskill their knowledge One summer Internship of a month compulsory for students to undertake. Excellent knowledge in research skills that will further help in academia or doctoral thesis Career Opportunities in research, data analysis, public relations, policy making, etc.
